creator: raghupatibandla@gmail.com
text:
If a variable being set using a regular expression extractor, doesn't get substituted when passed in as a parameter for the field "Remote File:" in "FTP Request"

Steps to reproduce:
1. Use a regular expression extractor in a blank test plan to set a variable X(Reference Name)
ex: X = me.jpg. In my scenario I am reading file paths from a txt file and extracting the file names using a regular expression extractor and setting them to a variable

2. Add a sampler "FTP Request" and pass in the Variable X into the field "Remote File:"
ex: Remote File: ${X}

3. Set the FTP Request to "PUT"

4. Add Debug Sampler, Results Tree and run your test

Result: Request for the FTP will look like:
ftp://localhost/${X} (Binary)  <- C:\Users\me\Desktop\me.jpg

instead of:
ftp://localhost/me.jpg (Binary)  <- C:\Users\me\Desktop\me.jpg

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Created attachment 30120
Test Plan showing it works

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
As attached test plan shows it, it works for me.
Maybe check extraction was fine using a debug sampler before ftp sampler.

Feel free to open with more details
Thanks for the attachment, that helped a lot with determining what I was doing wrong..
